deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2063-07-12
HISTORY AND PHYSICAL NOTE
Reason for referral: 53 year old male with ESRD here for dialysis access consultation.
History of Present Illness: Mr. Kaufman had a left AVF constructed in November 2062 and had an angiographic procedure to dilate the fistula recently. This eventually thrombosed. He doesn't want a right hand procedure and is here for evaluation for a graft.
Past Medical History:
diabetes
hypertension
CAD
Medications
Labetalol HCL 400 MG (200MG TABLET take 2) PO BID
Lipitor (ATORVASTATIN) 10 MG (10MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS
Cozaar (LOSARTAN) 100 MG (100MG TABLET take 1) PO QD
Neurontin (GABAPENTIN) 300 MG (300MG CAPSULE take 1) PO BID
Asa (ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID) 325 MG (325MG TABLET take 1) PO QD
Renaphro 1 TAB PO QD
Nexium (ESOMEPRAZOLE) 20 MG (20MG CAPSULE DR take 1) PO QD
Allergies: NKDA
Family History: Non contributory
Social History: Non contributory
Review of Systems: Negative x 10 systems other than noted above.
Physical Examination:
General: WNL
Vital signs: WNL
Head: Normal
Oropharynx: WNL
Neck: WNL
Skin: WNL
Lymph: WNL
Chest/back: WNL
Coronary: Normal S1,S2, no murmur, gallop or rub appreciated. No lifts, RRR
Lungs: Clear to Percussion and Auscultation
Abdomen: Soft, NT, without hepatomegaly, splenomegaly, bladder distention or masses, NABS, no bruits
GU: Normal external genitalia
Rectal: Normal tone, without masses or tenderness, stool hemocult ___________
Vascular: Femorals, DPs, PTs intact, no bruits
Extremities: No evidence of any usable cephalic vein, need arteriovenous graft
Neuro: Nonfocal and intact to a screening exam
Laboratory:
Impressions: In summary, Mr. Kaufman can have a left AV graft placed from AVF to antecubital region using an ARTEGRAFT. We will schedule this procedure and he knows the risks and benefits of the procedure and wishes to proceed.
_____________________________________________
Carroll Nolan, MD
